meanings.definition: Having the ability to resist or withstand something.
meanings.sent1: The thick walls of the castle were resistive to enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The new material is resistive to water, making it perfect for raincoats.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door was resistive to opening, causing frustration for the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her resistive nature towards change made her a reliable friend in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The resistive force of the magnet pulling the metal was surprisingly strong.

meanings.sent1: The resistive students refused to follow the new school rules.
meanings.sent2: The resistive attitude of the cat made it challenging to give it a bath.
meanings.sent3: The resistive puppy playfully resisted getting into the bath, wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her resistive personality clashed with his easygoing nature, causing tension.
meanings.sent5: The resistive plants in the garden fought against the strong winds, staying upright.
